page.title: 12LOCAL PLANT NURSERY B/BRIGGS
page.content: INTERVIEW WITH PLANT NURSERY EMPLOYEE 1{HOW LONG HAS THIS NURSERY BEEN HERE? APPROX.18 YEARS PRIOR TO THE LAND BETWEEN CADDER ROAD AND BALMUILDY ROAD WAS FARMLAND. 2{DO YOU KNOW ROUGHLY HOW MANY PLANT {TYPES THERE ARE?} ON ONE OCCASION THERE WERE 70 DIFFERENT TYPES OF PLANTS BEING GROWN. 3{WHERE DO MOST OF THESE PLANTS GO?} THEY GO TO THE COUNCIL CHAMBERS,PUBLIC BUILDINGS,LIBRARIES,HALLS,SPORTS CENTRES AND THROUGHOUT STRATHKELVIN. 4{HOW MANY PEOPLE WORK HERE?} 42 PEOPLE WORK HERE. 5{DO YOU HAVE PLANTS WHICH HAVE COME {FROM OTHER COUNTRIES?} THERE ARE FEW NATIVE PLANTS IN THE BRITISH ISLES DUE TO THE ICE AGE, BUT MOST HAVE BEEN INTRODUCED BY PLANT COLLECTORS.
